resources.string: If you are suicidal, I want you to know that virtually every person that I have talked with who attempted suicide, and survived, was glad that they lived. So the emotions that were causing the suicidal feelings did pass. Things got better; the sun did come out. So, let me extend that hope to you. \n\nPlease look at the Safety Plan module of this application. There, you can fill out a safety plan that can keep you safe during difficult times as well as find a list of helpful resources. Specifically, I want to encourage you to call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). They are there to help you, even if you are not in a suicidal crisis.

You can also press the button above to call the national suicide prevention lifeline and fill out the safety plan with the assistance of a Lifeline counselor. Once you reach a counselor, put the call on speakerphone and navigate back to this application.
